alert.note: Alert for Inyo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 12:47PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is on-going. * WHERE...Portions of southeast California and south central Nevada, including the following counties, in southeast California, Inyo. In south central Nevada, Esmeralda and Nye. * WHEN...Until 345 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Significant flooding has been reported in Death Valley National Park and all park roads are currently closed. In addition, several other roads, including CA 136, are closed across the advisory area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1242 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pahrump, Furnace Creek, Stovepipe Wells, Beatty, Shoshone, Olancha, Lone Pine, Texas Springs Campground, Panamint Springs, Amargosa Valley, Lathrop Wells, Death Valley Junction, Mesquite Springs Campground, Scottys Castle, Darwin, Keeler, Tecopa, Cartago, Diaz Lake and Portagee Lake Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
